cast.name: 迈克尔·雷德格瑞夫 Michael Redgrave

writer.name: 戈登·维尔斯利 Gordon Wellesley
居伊·德卡尔 Guy des Cars

director.name: 乔治·莫尔·奥费拉尔 George More O'Ferrall

introduction: The Green Scarf may be set in France, but its cast, crew, and overall tone is impeccably British. Michael Redgrave, hidden beneath a mattress of whiskers, portrays a French lawyer who takes on a seemingly hopeless case. His client, Kieron Moore, is a blind deaf-mute seaman accused of murder. Moore has already confessed to the crime, but Redgrave is sworn to give the best defense possible. At times, however, it is the dullest defense possible, despite a few random spurts of imagination. The Green Scarf was adapted from the novel The Brute by Guy des Cars.
